string-array.name: records_management
string-array.item: Does the facility have an adequate range of Work Health and Safety records?

string-array.name: whsms_audit
string-array.item: Are there any safety or quality auditing systems in place within the department?

string-array.name: management_review
string-array.item: Is there evidence that management review Work Health and Safety management to ensure suitability, adequacy and effectiveness?
Is the review of the Work Health and Safety Management System evaluated in regards to organisational change and its commitment to continual improvement?

string-array.name: policy_questions
string-array.item: Is an up to date copy of the written (WHS) Policy available at the location?
Is the policy communicated to all staff/contractors/visitors within the organisation?
Are there relevant organisational or other policies appropriate to the hazards and risks associated with the activities, products and/or services?
Is there a written statement describing arrangements for managing health and safety in the organisation?

string-array.name: policy_rationale
string-array.item: It is good practice to display a copy of the Work Health and Safety Policy at prominent locations throughout the organisation.
If the organisation has specific hazards and risks that arise from the work activities, there should be policies and procedures in place for these.

Good practice is to have a written statement outlining devolved responsibilities for health and safety. This should include organisational structures, processes for ensuring management control and named persons accountable for elements of these processes.

string-array.name: planning_questions
string-array.item: Have the key safety hazards/risks that may be encountered with all activities, products and/or services been identified
Are all of these hazards/risks evaluated for their impact on the health and safety of persons?
Do purchasing procedures (for goods, services or contractors) include health and safety as a weighted consideration based on risk?
Are there arrangements for obtaining up to date work health and safety information on hazards, risks, and preventative measures?
Is there a procedure to ensure staff are kept up to date with relevant work health and safety legislation?
Does the area establish, implement and maintain documented work health and safety objectives and targets?
Have Work Health and Safety objectives and targets been communicated to all relevant persons?
Are the targets linked to other relevant plans?
Are priorities based on the outcome of risk evaluations?
Are objectives periodically reviewed?
Is there an annual Work Health and Safety Plan for the organisation?
Are time frames and responsibility for achieving the Work Health and Safety plan established?
How and when is the Work Health and Safety plan reviewed?
Have the key safety hazards/risks that may be encountered with all activities, products and/or services been identified?
Are all of these hazards/risks evaluated for their impact on the work health and safety of persons?

string-array.name: planning_rationale
string-array.item: How are risks identified and prioritised? What are the highest risk activities or processes undertaken by the organisation? I.e. manual handling, fieldwork, chemical use, radiation, biological hazards etc.Is there a plan to identify any future risks?
The risks should be evaluated to give order of priority. Risk rating systems should follow appropriate organisational methodology.Is there a plan to identify any future risks?
When purchasing goods or services, work health and safety should be a deciding factor, based upon the risk.
Do you have means of getting Work Health and Safety information specific to your organisation?
What arrangements do you have for disseminating information within the work area?
Objectives should be set to make improvements (particularly regarding risk evaluations, inspections, workplace precautions, risk control systems, or management arrangements
For example, Targets linked to strategic plans

string-array.name: implementation_questions
string-array.item: Do you allocate resources to address work health and safety needs?
Have roles, responsibilities and authorities been defined, documented and communicated to all relevant personnel to ensure effective devolved Work Health and Safety management?
Has a senior manager been nominated to co-ordinate and monitor policy implementation?
Are persons familiar with their defined Work Health and Safety management roles and responsibilities?
Are persons with devolved responsibilities appraised on their work health and safety performance?
Do you have an appointed Workplace Health and Safety Representative?
Have the required competences been identified and recorded for all tasks and positions which may impact on Work Health and Safety in the unit?
Is there a process for ensuring that personnel performing tasks are competent, considering their education, training and/or experience, and the work context?
Do all new employees and contractors complete a safety induction?
Are training needs related to Work Health and Safety identified?
Are there procedures to ensure that all personnel receive appropriate training?
Are training needs related to Work Health and Safety identified?
Are there documented procedures for staff and contractor consultation in work health and safety issues?
Are there records demonstrating consultation?
Are there arrangements to communicate work health and safety information?
Are there procedures to show how hazards, incidents and injuries will be reported?
Is there a method to ensure safety related documents and amendments can be located, and are approved for adequacy by authorised personnel before issue?
Are documents adequately distributed to ensure ready access to personnel who play an essential role in Work Health and Safety management?
Are documents: legible, dated (with dates of revision), readily identifiable, maintained in an orderly manner and retained for a specified period?
Are there ongoing arrangements for identifying hazards?
Are regular workplace inspections carried out?
Are there ongoing arrangements for reporting hazards?
Is there a written procedure on hazard identification and risk assessment?
Are all new processes, plant and equipment or activities risk assessed prior to purchase or tender?
Have risk assessments been carried out on the hazards identified?
Is the information derived from risk assessments used to establish risk control measures?
Have the risks identified been set in order of priority?
Do decisions about risk control measures take account of the relevant legal requirements which establish minimum levels of risk prevention or control?
Are there arrangements for regularly reviewing risk assessments?
Are there procedures to respond to potential incidents, injuries and emergencies and to minimise risks and consequences from such situations?
Has overall responsibility been allocated for control of emergency situations and has this been communicated?
Are emergency response procedures periodically tested, reviewed and revised?
Are emergency preparedness and response procedures reviewed and revised after the occurrence of incidents, injuries or emergency situations?
Are the relevant emergency preparedness and response procedures communicated to staff, contractors and others as required?
Are emergency preparedness and response procedures reviewed and revised after the occurrence of incidents, injuries or emergency situations?

string-array.name: measurment_questions
string-array.item: Is there an inspection plan and does it identify the frequency of inspections?
Are the relevant emergency preparedness and response procedures communicated to staff, contractors and others as required?
Are records kept for each inspection with details of both positive and negative findings?
Are there procedures to determine what must be monitored in relation to Work Health and Safety and how this will be achieved?
If staff require health monitoring, is this being carried out?
Are there procedures identifying who has responsibility and authority for investigating incidents?
Are the principles of safety risk management used when investigating incidents?
Are there procedures identifying who has responsibility and authority for initiating and completing both corrective and preventative action?
Are changes in the documented procedures resulting from corrective and preventative action to avoid repetition of problems and deficiencies implemented and recorded?
Are there any changes to the Work Health and Safety Management System resulting from corrective actions?
Does the facility have an adequate range of Work Health and Safety records?
Are there any safety or quality auditing systems in place within the department?
Is there evidence that management review Work Health and Safety management to ensure suitability, adequacy and effectiveness?
Is the review of the Work Health and Safety Management System evaluated in regards to organisational change and its commitment to continual improvement?
